page.title: 18GUILDFORD: THE MEDIA
page.content: The Guildford area is served by all the national radio stations. County Sound, the local radio station, has been broadcasting for 24 hours a day since April 1983. It covers most of Surrey and the Hampshire border and is part of the I.L.R. network. Sixteen permanent disc-jockeys and forty-five other staff work there. Besides the four main national television channels, Guildford receives cable televsion as part of a pilot scheme for Britain. The local news is covered weekly by The Surrey Advertiser (cost 18p). It was started in 1864 and 45,000 copies are distributed around the county a week. The same company prints a free weekly paper, The Guildford Times. Another firm produces another free weekly paper, The Surrey Mail.{By A {Coleman,S Horlock,K Oduko,A Callegari
